items.label: cor-total-perturbation
items.title: Total Perturbation Bound (ρ-Dependent)
items.content:
1474: :label: cor-total-perturbation
1475: 
1476: The total perturbative contribution to the Stratonovich drift of $V_{\text{total}}$ satisfies:
1477: 
1478: $$
1479: A_{\text{perturb}}(S) \le \epsilon_F K_F(\rho) (V_{\text{total}}(S) + 1) + C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho) V_{\text{total}}(S)
1480: $$
1481: 
1482: where **all constants are ρ-dependent**:
1483: - The adaptive force contributes $O(\epsilon_F V_{\text{total}})$ with coefficient $K_F(\rho)$ (Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-adaptive-force-bounded`)
1484: - The viscous force contributes a negative (stabilizing) term $\le 0$ (Lemma [](#lem-viscous-dissipative))
1485: - The adaptive diffusion contributes $C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho) V_{\text{total}}$ (Lemma [](#lem-diffusion-bounded)), where the diffusion tensor depends on $H(\rho) = \nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$
1486: 
1487: Combining these and absorbing constants:
1488: 
1489: $$
1490: A_{\text{perturb}}(S) \le (\epsilon_F K_F(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho)) V_{\text{total}}(S) + (\epsilon_F K_F(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho))
1491: $$
1492: 
1493: **ρ-Dependence Interpretation:**
1494: - All perturbation bounds depend on ρ through the localized fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$
1495: - For any fixed ρ > 0, all bounds are finite
items.raw_directive:
1471: Combining the three lemmas, we obtain the total perturbation bound:
1472: 
1473: :::{prf:corollary} Total Perturbation Bound (ρ-Dependent)
1474: :label: cor-total-perturbation
1475: 
1476: The total perturbative contribution to the Stratonovich drift of $V_{\text{total}}$ satisfies:
1477: 
1478: $$
1479: A_{\text{perturb}}(S) \le \epsilon_F K_F(\rho) (V_{\text{total}}(S) + 1) + C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho) V_{\text{total}}(S)
1480: $$
1481: 
1482: where **all constants are ρ-dependent**:
1483: - The adaptive force contributes $O(\epsilon_F V_{\text{total}})$ with coefficient $K_F(\rho)$ (Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-adaptive-force-bounded`)
1484: - The viscous force contributes a negative (stabilizing) term $\le 0$ (Lemma [](#lem-viscous-dissipative))
1485: - The adaptive diffusion contributes $C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho) V_{\text{total}}$ (Lemma [](#lem-diffusion-bounded)), where the diffusion tensor depends on $H(\rho) = \nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$
1486: 
1487: Combining these and absorbing constants:
1488: 
1489: $$
1490: A_{\text{perturb}}(S) \le (\epsilon_F K_F(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho)) V_{\text{total}}(S) + (\epsilon_F K_F(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho))
1491: $$
1492: 
1493: **ρ-Dependence Interpretation:**
1494: - All perturbation bounds depend on ρ through the localized fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$
1495: - For any fixed ρ > 0, all bounds are finite
1496: - As ρ → ∞, the bounds recover those of the global backbone model

items.label: cor-exp-convergence
items.title: Exponential Convergence
items.content:
1685: :label: cor-exp-convergence
1686: 
1687: Under the conditions of Theorem [](#thm-fl-drift-adaptive), the empirical distribution $\mu_N(t)$ of the adaptive swarm converges exponentially fast to the unique Quasi-Stationary Distribution (QSD) $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ in the Lyapunov distance:
1688: 
1689: $$
1690: \mathbb{E}[V_{\text{total}}(\mu_N(t))] \le (1 - \kappa_{\text{total}})^t V_{\text{total}}(\mu_N(0)) + \frac{C_{\text{total}}}{\kappa_{\text{total}}}
1691: $$

items.title: Geometric Ergodicity via LSI
items.content:
2034: :label: cor-geometric-ergodicity-lsi
2035: 
2036: By Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-lsi-adaptive-gas`, exponential convergence in relative entropy implies geometric ergodicity. Specifically, by Pinsker's inequality:
2037: 
2038: $$
2039: \|\mu_t - \nu_N^{\text{QSD}}\|_{\text{TV}} \le \sqrt{2 \, \text{Ent}_{\nu_N^{\text{QSD}}}(\mu_t)}
2040: $$
2041: 
2042: Combining with Corollary {prf:ref}`cor-entropy-convergence-lsi`:
2043: 
2044: $$
2045: \|\mu_t - \nu_N^{\text{QSD}}\|_{\text{TV}} \le \sqrt{2 \, \text{Ent}_{\nu_N^{\text{QSD}}}(\mu_0)} \cdot \exp\left( -\frac{t}{2C_{\text{LSI}}} \right)
2046: $$

items.label: cor-axioms-verified
items.title: Verification of Axioms 3.2.1 and 3.2.3
items.content:
3054: :label: cor-axioms-verified
3055: 
3056: **1. Axiom of Bounded Adaptive Force (Axiom 3.2.1):** By Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-c1-regularity`, the adaptive force $\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}} = \epsilon_F \nabla V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$ satisfies:
3057: 
3058: $$
3059: \|\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}(x_i, S)\| \le \epsilon_F F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho) < \infty
3060: $$
3061: 
3062: for all swarm states $S$ and all $i \in \{1, \ldots, N\}$. This bound is N-uniform and depends only on ρ and the problem parameters.
3063: 
3064: **2. Axiom of Uniform Ellipticity (Axiom 3.2.3):** By Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-c2-regularity`, the Hessian $H_i(S) = \nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho](x_i)$ satisfies:
3065: 
3066: $$
3067: \|H_i(S)\| \le H_{\max}(\rho) < \infty
3068: $$
3069: 
3070: Therefore, the regularized metric $G_{\text{reg}} = (H + \epsilon_\Sigma I)^{-1}$ has eigenvalues bounded by:
3071: 
3072: $$
3073: \frac{1}{H_{\max}(\rho) + \epsilon_\Sigma} \le \lambda_{\min}(G_{\text{reg}}) \le \lambda_{\max}(G_{\text{reg}}) \le \frac{1}{\epsilon_\Sigma}
3074: $$
3075: 
3076: establishing uniform ellipticity with ρ-dependent lower bound $c_{\min}(\rho) = 1/(H_{\max}(\rho) + \epsilon_\Sigma)$.
